thread.title: Athlete of the week: St. Charles North girls golfer Megan Furtney
thread.title_full: Athlete of the week: St. Charles North girls golfer Megan Furtney

title: Athlete of the week: St. Charles North girls golfer Megan Furtney
text:
Freshman 
Why she was selected: 
Was medalist at Monday's Class AA Oak Park-River Forest Sectional at Cog Hill No. 1 in Lemont, shooting a 3-under 69 for the sectional champion North Stars 
Kane County Chronicle-St. Charles Bank & Trust Athlete of the Week Megan Furtney helped the St. Charles North girls golf team to the first team sectional title in program history on Monday. The freshman standout, just a year removed from Haines Middle School, shot a 69 and is bound for this weekend's Class AA state tournament in downstate Forsyth. Here's an edited transcript of Chronicle sports editor Kevin Druley's chat with Furtney: 
I heard some chatter about the pin placements at Cog Hill. What made them so tough? 
They really placed them on slopes, so it was really hard to try to get the ball to stick close to the pin. So I learned very quickly that you needed to keep it below the pin (Monday). It was really important. 
Middle schools don't offer competitive golf. How much does that put a premium on summer tournaments for you growing up? 
Just being able to compete in the summer, I find it so fun. And then to be able to have the opportunity to come out more competitive golf with the team over the fall, I thought it was really awesome. 
Where is a favorite practice spot of yours? 
Oh, Cantigny [in Wheaton]. ... Obviously, the course is great, and just the practice facility they have is so above and beyond.
